title: Here's how you can watch Blue Jays-Royals ALCS Game 2
text:
Here's how you can watch Blue Jays-Royals ALCS Game 2 Here's how you can watch Blue Jays-Royals ALCS Game 2 
Oct 14, 2015; Kansas City, MO, USA; Kansas City Royals designated hitter Kendrys Morales hits a three-run home run against the Houston Astros in the 8th inning in game five of the ALDS at Kauffman Stadium. (Peter G. Aiken/USA Today Sports) Like Sports News on Facebook: reviewjournal.com 
The American League Championship Series between the Toronto Blue Jays and the Kansas City Royals continues today with Game 2 at Kauffman Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri. 
Here's everything you need to know if you want to catch the game. 
Time: 1:07 p.m. PDT 
TV: Fox Sports 1 (Cox 329, DirecTV 219) 
Online: MLB.com (subscription required) 
Schedule through Game 7 (all times PDT): 
Game 3: Royals at Blue Jays — Monday, Oct. 19, 5:07 p.m. — Fox Sports 1 
Game 4: Royals at Blue Jays — Tuesday, Oct. 20, TBD — Fox Sports 1 
Game 5 (if necessary): Royals at Blue Jays — Wednesday, Oct. 21, TBD — Fox Sports 1 
Game 6 (if necessary) : Blue Jays at Royals — Friday, Oct. 23, TBD — Fox Sports 1 
Game 7 (if necessary) : Blue Jays at Royals — Saturday, Oct. 24, TBD — Fox Sports 1 Comment section guidelines The below comment section contains thoughts and opinions from users that in no way represent the views of the Las   or GateHouse Media.
